alert.note: Alert for Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 12:01PM CDT until June 01 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN LYNN COUNTY... At 1201 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicates flash flood producing thunderstorms. Sherriff office reports that US-87 has been closed about 4 miles north of O`Donnell. 6.5 inches of rain has fallen at O`Donnell since 9 AM. Flooding is also likely on US-380 between Tahoka and Post. The heaviest rain is shifting east-northeast of Tahoka. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tahoka and O`Donnell. TXDOT reports that all low water crossings were flooded east and south of Tahoka. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
